snippet: In his effort to right California’s finances, and secure a fourth term, Gov. Jerry Brown wants voters to approve a constitutional amendment requiring that surpluses be used to pay down debt.
abstract: California Gov Jerry Brown proposes vote on constitutional amendment requiring state's budget surpluses be used to pay down municipal debt and create an emergency fund; proposal comes as unexpected boom has ended years of budget shortfalls and fiscal dysfunction.
lead_paragraph: In his effort to right California’s finances, and secure a fourth term, Gov. Jerry Brown wants voters to approve a constitutional amendment requiring that surpluses be used to pay down debt.

headline.main: In California, Governor Pushes a Rainy-Day Fund
headline.print_headline: In California, Governor Pushes a Rainy-Day Fund
